      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate(java.lang.String login,
                            java.lang.String password)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Authenticates the user with a given login and password. If password and/or login is null then always returns false. If the user does not exist in the database returns false.
        Parameters:
        login - String The login of the user
        password - String The password of the user
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the user is authenticated, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the database is inconsistent or unavailable ( (Two users with the same login, salt or digested password altered etc.)
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the algorithm SHA-1 is not supported by the JVM

      • createUser

        public boolean createUser(java.lang.String login,
                          java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                          java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Inserts a new user in the database
        Parameters:
        login - String The login of the user
        password - String The password of the user
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if the login and password are ok (not null and length(login)<=100
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the database is unavailable
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the algorithm SHA-1 or the SecureRandom is not supported by the JVM
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • getHash

        public byte[] getHash(int iterationNb,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      byte[] salt)
               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        From a password, a number of iterations and a salt, returns the corresponding digest
        Parameters:
        iterationNb - int The number of iterations of the algorithm
        password - String The password to encrypt
        salt - byte[] The salt
        Returns:
        byte[] The digested password
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the algorithm doesn't exist
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
